finalProject

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • finalProject.Navigator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Thread
    The class responsible for moving the robot.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mathieu Bolduc

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigator

        public Navigator(Odometer odometer,
         EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
         EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor)
        Constructor for Navigator.
        Parameters:
        odometer - The odometer that the navigator will get its position from. Must have getters for x, y and theta.
        leftMotor - The left motor.
        rightMotor - The right motor.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Turns the robot to the specified absolute angle theta using the shortest possible way (within ~3 degrees). Does not change the position of the robot: it turns on itself. Cancels any previous move commands.
        Parameters:
        theta - The absolute angle to turn to. In rads between 0 and 2pi, counterclockwise from the positive x axis.

      • turnBy

        public void turnBy(double theta)
        Turns by the specified angle relative to the robot's current angle (within ~3 degrees). Does not change the position of the robot: it turns on itself. Cancels any previous move commands.
        Parameters:
        theta - The angle to turn by. In rads between 0 and 2pi, positive for left, negative for right.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y)
        Moves the robot to the specified coordinates in a straight line (within ~1cm). Minor corrections may be done along the path so that the robot always faces its destination. The final orientation of the robot is somewhat random due to those corrections. Cancels any previous move commands.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the target destination.
        y - The y coordinate of the target destination.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y,
            boolean forward)
        Moves the robot to the specified coordinates in a straight line (within ~1cm). Minor corrections may be done along the path so that the robot always faces its destination. The final orientation of the robot is somewhat random due to those corrections. Cancels any previous move commands.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the target destination.
        y - The y coordinate of the target destination.
        forward - True for forward, false for backward.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double[] destination)
        Moves the robot to the specified coordinates in a straight line (within ~1cm). Minor corrections may be done along the path so that the robot always faces its destination. The final orientation of the robot is somewhat random due to those corrections. Cancels any previous move commands.
        Parameters:
        destination - The array representing the target destination in the form {x, y}.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double[] destination,
            boolean forward)
        Moves the robot to the specified coordinates in a straight line (within ~1cm). Minor corrections may be done along the path so that the robot always faces its destination. The final orientation of the robot is somewhat random due to those corrections. Cancels any previous move commands.
        Parameters:
        destination - The array representing the target destination in the form {x, y}.
        forward - True for forward, false for backward.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(double x,
             double y)
        Sets the target of the navigator, but does not start moving yet. Use move() to start the navigator.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the target destination.
        y - The y coordinate of the target destination.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(double x,
             double y,
             boolean forward)
        Sets the target of the navigator, but does not start moving yet. Use move() to start the navigator.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the target destination.
        y - The y coordinate of the target destination.
        forward - True for forward, false for backward.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(double[] destination)
        Sets the target of the navigator, but does not start moving yet. Use move() to start the navigator.
        Parameters:
        destination - The array representing the target destination in the form {x, y}.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(double[] destination,
             boolean forward)
        Sets the target of the navigator, but does not start moving yet. Use move() to start the navigator.
        Parameters:
        destination - The array representing the target destination in the form {x, y}.
        forward - True for forward, false for backward.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Stops the robot dead in its tracks until either move(), travelTo() or turnTo() is called. Does not cancel previous target destinations: the robot will keep going to the same destination if the move() method is called. The navigator will however keep recalculating targetTheta while it is paused.

      • move

        public void move()
        Unpauses the navigator if it was previously paused. Does nothing if the navigator was not paused.

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Returns true if and only if the robot is currently moving via the navigator.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the robot is moving.

      • getTargetX

        public double getTargetX()
        Returns the x value of the navigator's current destination. A value of NaN means that there is no destination currently.
        Returns:
        The x value of the current destination.

      • getTargetY

        public double getTargetY()
        Returns the y value of the navigator's current destination. A value of NaN means that there is no destination currently.
        Returns:
        The y value of the current destination.

      • getTargetT

        public double getTargetT()
        Returns the angle that the robot is trying to achieve (the angle between itself and its destination). A value of NaN means that there is no destination currently.
        Returns:
        The angle between the robot and its destination. In rads between 0 and 2pi, counterclockwise from the positive x axis.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the navigator's target which fits the EV3's LCD screen.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Thread
        Returns:
        The navigator's target x and y, in string form.

      • waitForStop

        public void waitForStop()
        Waits until the navigator stops navigating.
